review: This is a very cheap alternative to other set top boxes and the chromecast. If you are heavily invested in Amazon Instant Video or need a remote for your streaming device, then you can't go wrong with this. However, you can get better alternatives. This device has good specs on paper but it does lag in everyday use. For instance, the Netflix and Hulu apps can both get pretty laggy when browsing titles. When you stream a titles it does load fast and buffers quickly, but this is more to do with how fast your wifi is. There is no ethernet port, which is disappointing but expected since its a cheap stick streaming device like the chromecast or roku stick.Right now there are not a lot of streaming services outside of Amazon, Netflix, and Hulu Plus. There is no HBO GO yet. The Plex app stuttered and lagged a lot during playback for me. YouTube is really laggy and casting to it from a mobile device doesn't work half the time. Also, the Twitch app is severely lacking at the moment. This could change in the future however.The remote is very comfortable and does what it is supposed to. It's light and feels good in the hand. The buttons are nice and clicky.Personally, I use my iPhone a lot and just use a Chromecast to watch media.
